         <li id="cite_note-Rejects-142"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Rejects_142-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://drum.lib.umd.edu/bitstream/handle/1903/10127/Afghanistan_Jan06_art2.pdf;jsessionid=51A568EB80A658471A265A1D06EF8ADB?sequence=3">"WPO Poll: Afghan Public Overwhelmingly Rejects al-Qaeda, Taliban"</a>. 30 January 2006. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20170102172723/http://drum.lib.umd.edu/bitstream/handle/1903/10127/Afghanistan_Jan06_art2.pdf;jsessionid=51A568EB80A658471A265A1D06EF8ADB?sequence=3">Archived</a> from the original on 2 January 2017<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">2 January</span> 2017</span>. <q>Equally large percentages endorse the US military presence in Afghanistan. Eighty-three percent said they have a favorable view of "the US military forces in our country" (39% very favorable). Just 17% have an unfavorable view.</q></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=WPO+Poll%3A+Afghan+Public+Overwhelmingly+Rejects+al-Qaeda%2C+Taliban&amp;rft.date=2006-01-30&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fdrum.lib.umd.edu%2Fbitstream%2Fhandle%2F1903%2F10127%2FAfghanistan_Jan06_art2.pdf%3Bjsessionid%3D51A568EB80A658471A265A1D06EF8ADB%3Fsequence%3D3&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AAfghanistan" class="Z3988"></span></span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-Public_Opinion-143"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Public_Opinion_143-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://acsor-surveys.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/01/Afghan-Futures-Wave-6-Analysis_FINAL-v2.pdf">"Afghan Futures: A National Public Opinion Survey"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. 29 January 2015. p.&nbsp;4. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20170329093740/http://acsor-surveys.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/01/Afghan-Futures-Wave-6-Analysis_FINAL-v2.pdf">Archived</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span> from the original on 29 March 2017<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">2 January</span> 2017</span>. <q>Seventy-seven percent support the presence of U.S. forces; 67 percent say the same of NATO/ISAF forces more generally. Despite the country's travails, eight in 10 say it was a good thing for the United States to oust the Taliban in 2001. And much more blame either the Taliban or al Qaeda for the country's violence, 53 percent, than blame the United States, 12 percent. The latter is about half what it was in 2012, coinciding with a sharp reduction in the U.S. deployment.</q></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=Afghan+Futures%3A+A+National+Public+Opinion+Survey&amp;rft.pages=4&amp;rft.date=2015-01-29&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Facsor-surveys.com%2Fwp-content%2Fuploads%2F2015%2F01%2FAfghan-Futures-Wave-6-Analysis_FINAL-v2.pdf&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AAfghanistan" class="Z3988"></span></span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-NYTOct8-144"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-NYTOct8_144-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">

           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.bbc.com/news/world-south-asia-11371138">"The foreign troops left in Afghanistan"</a>. 15 October 2015 â via www.bbc.co.uk.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=The+foreign+troops+left+in+Afghanistan&amp;rft.date=2015-10-15&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.bbc.com%2Fnews%2Fworld-south-asia-11371138&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AAfghanistan" class="Z3988"></span></span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-160"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-160">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">

         <li id="cite_note-South_Asia-172"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-South_Asia_172-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">* 
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20131225134851/http://pubs.usgs.gov/of/1997/ofr-97-470/OF97-470C/asiaGmap.html">"U.S. maps"</a>.             <li>
             <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.worldbank.org/en/region/sar">"South Asia: Data, Projects, and Research"</a>. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20150301035209/http://www.worldbank.org/en/region/sar">Archived</a> from the original on 1 March 2015<span class="reference-accessdate">.             <li>
             <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://pubs.usgs.gov/of/1997/ofr-97-470/OF97-470C/asiaGmap.html">"MAPS SHOWING GEOLOGY, OIL AND GAS FIELDS AND GEOLOGICAL PROVINCES OF SOUTH ASIA (Includes Afghanistan)"</a>. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20131225134851/http://pubs.usgs.gov/of/1997/ofr-97-470/OF97-470C/asiaGmap.html">Archived</a> from the original on 25 December 2013<span class="reference-accessdate">.             <li>
             <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20150402100846/http://jsis.washington.edu/advise/catalog/soasia-b.html">"University of Washington Jackson School of International Studies: The South Asia Center"</a>.          <li id="cite_note-188"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-188">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">

         <li id="cite_note-UN_WPP-200"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-UN_WPP_200-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://population.un.org/wpp/">"<span class="cs1-kern-left">"</span>World Population prospects â Population division<span class="cs1-kern-right">"</span>"</a>. <i>population.un.org</i>. <a href="/wiki/United_Nations_Department_of_Economic_and_Social_Affairs" title="United Nations Department of Economic and Social Affairs">United Nations Department of Economic and Social Affairs</a>, Population Division<span class="reference-accessdate">.          <li id="cite_note-216"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-216">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">

         <li id="cite_note-233"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-233">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://edition.cnn.com/2013/11/24/world/asia/us-afghanistan-security-agreement/">"Loya jirga approves U.S.-Afghan security deal; asks Karzai to sign"</a>.          <li id="cite_note-302"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-302">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">"<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.dailyfinance.com/2010/06/14/china-us-afghanistan-mineral-mining/">China, Not U.S., Likely to Benefit from Afghanistan's Mineral Riches</a>". <i>Daily Finance</i>. 14 June 2010 <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20131231001630/http://www.dailyfinance.com/2010/06/14/china-us-afghanistan-mineral-mining/">Archived</a> 31 December 2013 at the <a href="/wiki/Wayback_Machine" title="Wayback Machine">Wayback Machine</a></span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-303"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-303">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation news cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20110731145815/http://www.nytimes.com/2009/12/30/world/asia/30mine.html">"China Willing to Spend Big on Afghan Commerce"</a>. <i>The New York Times</i>. 29 December 2009.                    <li><a href="/wiki/Paktika_Province" title="Paktika Province">Paktika</a></li> 
                   <li><a href="/wiki/Panjshir_Province" title="Panjshir Province">Panjshir</a></li> 
                   <li><a href="/wiki/Parwan_Province" title="Parwan Province">Parwan</a></li> 
                   <li><a href="/wiki/Samangan_Province" title="Samangan Province">Samangan</a></li> 
                   <li><a href="/wiki/Sar-e_Pol_Province" title="Sar-e Pol Province">Sar-e Pol</a></li> 
                   <li><a href="/wiki/Takhar_Province" title="Takhar Province">Takhar</a></li> 
                   <li><a href="/wiki/Uruzgan_Province" title="Uruzgan Province">Uruzgan</a></li> 
                   <li><a href="/wiki/Zabul_Province" title="Zabul Province">Zabul</a></li>
                  </ul> 
                 </div></td>
                <td class="noviewer navbox-image" rowspan="1" style="width:1px;padding:0px 0px 0px 2px">
                 <div>
                  <style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r936637989">.mw-parser-output .portal{border:solid #aaa 1px;padding:0}.mw-parser-output .portal.tleft{margin:0.5em 1em 0.5em 0}.mw-parser-output .portal.tright{margin:0.5em 0 0.5em 1em}.mw-parser-output .portal>ul{display:table;box-sizing:border-box;padding:0.1em;max-width:175px;background:#f9f9f9;font-size:85%;line-height:110%;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold}.mw-parser-output .portal>ul>li{display:table-row}.mw-parser-output .portal>ul>li>span:first-child{display:table-cell;padding:0.2em;vertical-align:middle;text-align:center}.mw-parser-output .portal>ul>li>span:last-child{display:table-cell;padding:0.2em 0.2em 0.2em 0.3em;vertical-align:middle}</style>
                  <div role="navigation" aria-label="Portals" class="noprint portal plainlist tright"> 
                   <ul> 
                    <li><span><img alt="flag" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9a/Flag_of_Afghanistan.svg/32px-Flag_of_Afghanistan.svg.png" decoding="async" width="32" height="21" class="noviewer thumbborder" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9a/Flag_of_Afghanistan.svg/48px-Flag_of_Afghanistan.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9a/Flag_of_Afghanistan.svg/64px-Flag_of_Afghanistan.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="900" data-file-height="600"></span><span><a href="/wiki/Portal:Afghanistan" title="Portal:Afghanistan">Afghanistan portal</a></span></li>
                   </ul>
                  </div>
                 </div></td>
               </tr>
              </tbody>
             </table>

               <tr>
                <th scope="row" class="navbox-group" style="width:1%">Members</th>
                <td class="navbox-list navbox-odd hlist" style="text-align:left;border-left-width:2px;border-left-style:solid;width:100%;padding:0px">
                 <div style="padding:0em 0.25em"> 
                  <ul>
                   <li><span class="flagicon"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9a/Flag_of_Afghanistan.svg/23px-Flag_of_Afghanistan.svg.png" decoding="async" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9a/Flag_of_Afghanistan.svg/35px-Flag_of_Afghanistan.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9a/Flag_of_Afghanistan.svg/45px-Flag_of_Afghanistan.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="900" data-file-height="600">&nbsp;</span><a class="mw-selflink selflink">Afghanistan</a></li>

                <th scope="row" class="navbox-group" style="width:1%;background-color:#DCDCDC;">Invasion and<br>occupation</th>
                <td class="navbox-list navbox-odd" style="text-align:left;border-left-width:2px;border-left-style:solid;width:100%;padding:0px">
                 <div style="padding:0em 0.25em">

                   <li><a href="/wiki/NATO_logistics_in_the_Afghan_War" title="NATO logistics in the Afghan War">Logistics</a></li> 
                   <li><a href="/wiki/International_Security_Assistance_Force" title="International Security Assistance Force">International Security Assistance Force</a></li>

                  </ul> 
                 </div></td>
               </tr>
